tk_json module

tk_json.assign_instructor_to_course()[source]

Assigns an instructor to a course by setting the course’s instructor field. Ensures both the instructor and course exist before assignment.

Raises:

ValueError – If the instructor or course is not found.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

tk_json.course_window()[source]

Opens a new window in the UI to allow adding a new course to the application, including its course ID and course name. Assigns the first available instructor by default.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

tk_json.delete_record()[source]

Deletes the selected record (student, instructor, or course) from the respective list and refreshes the UI. Ensures the record exists before deletion.

Raises:

ValueError – If no record is selected or if the record is not found.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

tk_json.display_records(search_term='')[source]

Displays the records (students, instructors, courses) in the Treeview UI element, filtered by the provided search term. Searches by name or ID.

Parameters:

search_term (str, optional) – The term used to filter the records by name or ID, defaults to an empty string for no filter.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

tk_json.edit_record_popup()[source]

Opens a popup window to edit the selected student, instructor, or course. Updates the selected record with the new values and refreshes the UI after saving.

Raises:

ValueError – If no record is selected.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

tk_json.instructor_window()[source]

Opens a new window in the UI to allow adding a new instructor to the application, including their name, age, email, and instructor ID.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

tk_json.load_data()[source]

Loads students, instructors, and courses data from a JSON file and populates the application with the loaded data. Also reassigns enrolled students to their respective courses.

Raises:

  • FileNotFoundError – If the data file does not exist.

  • IOError – If there is an issue reading from the file.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

tk_json.refresh_treeview()[source]

Refreshes the Treeview UI element to display the most up-to-date information about students, instructors, and courses.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

tk_json.register_course()[source]

Registers a student for a course by adding the student to the course’s enrolled students list. Ensures the student and course exist before enrollment.

Raises:

ValueError – If the student or course is not found.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

tk_json.save_data()[source]

Saves the students, instructors, and courses data to a JSON file. This includes information about enrolled students and assigned instructors for courses.

Raises:

IOError – If there is an issue writing to the file.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

tk_json.search_records()[source]

Searches for records based on the input in the search bar and displays them in the UI.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

tk_json.student_window()[source]

Opens a new window in the UI to allow adding a new student to the application, including their name, age, email, and student ID.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

tk_json.update_course_combobox()[source]

Updates the combobox elements in the UI with the latest list of available courses from the courses list.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None
